assumptions.text: vietnamese-ai-consciousness OODA framework is compatible with DAIOF workflows

safetyChecklist.details: Local execution eliminates GitHub Actions costs
All changes in DAIOF can be reverted via git
Local scripts can be stopped anytime, no cloud lock-in

elementScores.rationale: PERFECT: Copying existing proven system = max safety, no vendor lock = max longevity, 1,375 LOC exist = max evidence, B·ªë controls local files = zero human risk
EXCELLENT: Symlink = less disk space, still max control, proven system, but slightly risky if source moves
POOR: Takes weeks, unproven code, bugs likely, high human effort required

elementScores.element: Activate workflows on GitHub Actions (paid plan)
elementScores.rationale: ACCEPTABLE but COSTLY: $252/year, vendor lock-in, proven platform

focalPoints.rationale: HIGHEST PRIORITY. SIMPLEST path to unlock $79,200/year value. 1,375 LOC ready-made system beats building from scratch (weeks of work). Local execution = cost $0. Copy takes 5 minutes, test takes 2 hours, activate same day. EVIDENCE: All files exist and verified. SAFETY: Copying preserves originals, Git rollback available. LONGEVITY: Local files under B·ªë's control forever. HUMAN RISK: Zero - B·ªë controls everything locally.

proposals.name: DIRECT COPY - Fastest Path to Value (RECOMMENDED ‚≠ê)
steps: STEP 1 (5 min): Copy OODA framework to DAIOF
git commit -m 'Add OODA framework from vietnamese-ai-consciousness'
- Add DAIOF-specific configuration (GitHub API, repo paths)
Verify: Observe phase reads health metrics
Verify: Act phase logs (but doesn't execute in dry-run)
STEP 4 (30 min): Setup local cron execution
(Runs every 10 minutes - adjust frequency as needed)
STEP 5 (1 hour): Monitor first autonomous run
Verify commits are pushed to GitHub
Verify cost = $0 (no GitHub Actions minutes used)
estimatedRisks: OODA framework might have dependencies not installed on B·ªë's MacBook
Integration wrapper might need tuning (OODA expects HyperAI context, DAIOF is different)
Cron job might fail if MacBook sleeps or loses network
First autonomous decisions might be suboptimal (needs tuning period)
mitigationActions: RISK 1: Run pip install -r requirements.txt if dependencies missing (add asyncio, dataclasses)
RISK 2: Create DAIOF adapter class to translate between OODA and DAIOF concepts
RISK 3: Set MacBook Energy Saver to 'Never sleep when plugged in'
RISK 4: Start with dry-run mode for 24 hours, review logs, then enable Act phase
auditChecklist: ‚úÖ Dry-run mode passes all 4 OODA phases
‚úÖ First autonomous commit pushed to GitHub
‚úÖ Cost = $0 verified (no GitHub Actions minutes consumed)
‚úÖ B·ªë reviews and approves autonomous decisions

proposals.name: SYMLINK - Save Disk Space (Alternative)
steps: STEP 1 (2 min): Create symlink instead of copying
git add ooda (symlink tracked in git)
ADVANTAGE: No file duplication, saves disk space
DISADVANTAGE: If source folder moves/deletes, symlink breaks
estimatedRisks: Symlink breaks if vietnamese-ai-consciousness folder moves
Git might not handle symlinks well on all platforms (macOS OK, Windows issues)

proposals.name: GRADUAL INTEGRATION - Test Each Phase (Conservative)
steps: DAY 1: Copy OODA framework + Test Observe phase only
Test: Observe phase reads health_monitor.py metrics
Verify: Data collection works, no crashes
Test: Orient phase analyzes metrics from Day 1
Verify: Mental model built correctly, context understood
Test: Decide phase generates decisions (dry-run, no execution)
Verify: Decisions are sound, confidence scores reasonable
Test: Act phase logs what it WOULD do (no actual commits)
Verify: Actions are safe, reversible, aligned with goals
Enable: Act phase can now make real commits
Monitor: First 24 hours closely, ready to disable if issues
estimatedRisks: Slower time to value (1 week vs 4 hours)
B·ªë must review each phase daily (time commitment)
Might discover issues late (on Day 4-5 instead of Day 1)
mitigationActions: Accept slower pace for higher confidence
Schedule 30-min daily review sessions with B·ªë
Keep detailed logs of each phase for troubleshooting
auditChecklist: ‚úÖ Day 1: Observe phase tested and approved
‚úÖ Day 2: Orient phase tested and approved
‚úÖ Day 3: Decide phase tested and approved by B·ªë
‚úÖ Day 4: Act phase (dry-run) tested and approved
‚úÖ Day 5: Act phase (production) enabled and monitored
‚úÖ 1 week: Full OODA loop operational, B·ªë satisfied
